habitat_description: The Shenandoah salamander is closely related to other relict mountaintop Plethodons (P. hubrichti and P. nettingi). They are restricted to the north or northwest facing slopes of the Pinnacles, Stony Man Mountain, and Hawksbill Mountain in the Blue Ridge of north-central Virginia (Petranka 1998). This species occurs at elevations between 914 and 1143 m where they are confined to pockets of vegetation or debris in hardwood forested talus slopes and are extremely tolerant of dry conditions (Wilson 1995, Mitchell 2005). They breed terrestrially (Mitchell 2005).
